resource.name: Medical Examiner Cases
resource.description: This dataset includes all San Diego County accidental deaths, homicides, suicides, in-custody deaths, and a very small percentage of sudden or unexpected natural deaths in which the decedent had not seen a health care provider in the last 20 days of life.
resource.attribution: County of San Diego Department of the Medical Examiner
columns_description: A description of the cause of death.
A non-identifiable row number has been added to distinguish individual case records.
Gender
General categorization of Event Place.
Zip code where the event causing death occurred.
General categorization of Death Place.
Decedent's city of residence.
City where death occurred.
Includes a child age grouping from age 0-14 and then 10 increments beginning with 15-24.
This includes conditions that contributed to the cause of death.
Zip code where death occurred.
Decedent's Zip code of residence.
Includes child and young adult age groupings in 5 year increments through age 24, then in 10 year increments beginning with 25-34..
Decedent's date of death.
Calendar year quarter based on the date of death or the quarter in which the Medical Examiner took jurisdiction if outside of the current year.
Indicates if record is sealed or access free.
The age of the decedent at time of death, represented in whole years; individuals under the age of 1 are listed at age 0 years.
The year the Medical Examiner took jurisdiction of the case for investigation.
A standardized Manner Type of death to provide consistency due to categorizations that may have changed over time.
Race/Ethnicity as determined by the Medical Examiner.
Includes age groupings in 10 year increments, beginning with 0-9
This is the manner of death category: Natural, Accident, Homicide, Suicide, or Undetermined.
Place where death occurred.
Indicate if the event location was the Coronado Bay Bridge.
Time when the event causing death occurred.
This is the type or method of death determined by the Medical Examiner.
Ethnic Group categorization based upon the indicated race/ethnicity.
This is the sub-type or sub-method  of death determined by the Medical Examiner.
A standardized Manner Sub Type of death to provide consistency due to categorizations that may have changed over time.

Indicates if an Opioid is listed in the Cause of Death, Contributing Conditions, or How Injury Occurred column. Currently includes the following: opiate, opioid, U-47700, tramadol, oxymorphone, oxycodone, morphine, mitragynine, methadone, hydromorphone, hydrocodone, heroid, fentanyl, dihydrocodeine, codeine, buprenorphine, carfentanil
City where the event causing death occurred.
A description as to how the injury leading to death occurred.
Date when the event causing death occurred.
Place where the event causing death occurred.

domain_metadata.value: Due to the time span and complex nature of this data, additional columns have been added to assist with data analysis. For example: Opioid Related, Coronado Bridge Related, Manner Type Standardization, Manner Sub Type Standardization, and Age Groupings.

*The data follows privacy guidelines that protect the deceased person and person’s family, and so does not include names, dates of birth, case numbers or specific addresses. *This dataset only includes a very small percentage of all natural deaths (~5 percent) occurring within the county. *Only Manner of Death is included on cases with a sealed status. *Cases that are pending closure or still open and under investigation are not included.
